PETase discusses_metric stability. Evidence: Though the PETase from Ideonalla sakaiensis ( Is PETase) displays interesting PET 
degrading performance under mild conditions; the relatively low thermal stability of Is PETase limits its practical 
application.

HotPETase targets_substrate PET. Evidence: In this study, enzyme-catalysed PET degradation was investigated with the promising Is PETase 
mutant HotPETase (HP).

PETase discusses_metric activity. Evidence: Furthermore, to 
effectively improve PET accessibility and PET-degrading activity, the truncated outer membrane hybrid protein 
(FadL) was used to expose PETase and Ba CBM on the surface of E.

PET-hydrolase targets_substrate PET. Evidence: To date, various enzymes with efficient PET-degrading activity have 
been successfully identified; these enzymes are mainly members of the 
family of carboxylic ester hydrolases (EC 3.1.1.x), and most of them 
further fall into the subfamily of cutinases (cutinases or the cutinase-like 
PET-hydrolase), such as TfCut2, Cut190, HiC, and LCC ( Ellis et al., 2021; 
Zumstein et al., 2017; Tamoor et al.

MHETase targets_substrate PET. Evidence: In 2016, the bacterium Ideonella sakaiensis

film at 30 
◦
C for 40 days and hydrolyse PET with catalysis by two 
released enzymes (ISF6_4831 ( Is PETase) and ISF6_0224 ( Is MHETase)) 
( Yoshida et al., 2016 ).

PETase achieves_conversion 1% degradation. Evidence: Emphasizing on post-consumer bottles, both Dm PETase and LCC
ICCG 
demonstrated efficient degradation with 3 – 5% and 10 – 15% degradation 
yields, respectively, indicating that milling of the bottles, even without 
quenching, significantly enhances enzymatic degradation performance, 
due to the increase of the available surface area.

IsPETase active_temperature 65 °C. Evidence: Conclusions 
Despite IsPETase being initially considered a promising enzyme for PET degradation, multiple studies have 
shown that thermophilic PET hydrolases (e.g., LCC), when operating at temperatures above 65°C, 
outperform mesophilic enzymes in PET biorecycling.34 Since its publication in 2020, the LCC-ICCG variant 
has been considered the state-of-the-art PETase enzyme.

PETase active_temperature 65 °C. Evidence: Conclusions 
Despite IsPETase being initially considered a promising enzyme for PET degradation, multiple studies have 
shown that thermophilic PET hydrolases (e.g., LCC), when operating at temperatures above 65°C, 
outperform mesophilic enzymes in PET biorecycling.34 Since its publication in 2020, the LCC-ICCG variant 
has been considered the state-of-the-art PETase enzyme.

MHETase targets_substrate PET. Evidence: sakaiensis as the enzyme to hydrolyze MHET (MHETase) 
that wild-type IsPETase produces from PET but cannot 
hydrolyze (Palm et al.

MHETase targets_substrate MHET. Evidence: sakaiensis as the enzyme to hydrolyze MHET (MHETase) 
that wild-type IsPETase produces from PET but cannot 
hydrolyze (Palm et al.

IsPETase targets_substrate MHET. Evidence: sakaiensis as the enzyme to hydrolyze MHET (MHETase) 
that wild-type IsPETase produces from PET but cannot 
hydrolyze (Palm et al.

IsPETase active_temperature 25 °C. Evidence: strain TA144 and Oleispira antarctic 
RB-8, respectively, and hydrolyze PET at a rate comparable 
to IsPETase at 25 °C (Blázquez-Sánchez et al.

IsETase targets_substrate PET. Evidence: PET6 is like IsETase, but its 
activity was lower than IsPETase.

IsETase discusses_metric activity. Evidence: PET6 is like IsETase, but its 
activity was lower than IsPETase.

BhrPETase targets_substrate PET. Evidence: Subsequently, BhrPETase was cloned from the ther-
mophilic bacterial phylum Chloroflexi derived from a sub-
surface geothermal stream using a metagenomic approach.

DmPETase targets_substrate PET. Evidence: Recently, a thermophilic polyesterase DmPETase was cloned 
from Deinococcus maricopensis.

TurboPETase discusses_metric engineering. Evidence: The findings from LCC, PHL7 
(PES-H1) and TurboPETase suggest that any variants in sub-
sites I and II could cause improved performance, unless the 
core structure of the proteins is destroyed, and the interaction 
of amino acids with PET is well tuned.

BhrPETase discusses_metric engineering. Evidence: This combined mutation is useful for 
LCC, Est119 and BhrPETase.

IsPETase has_mutation H184S. Evidence: H184S corresponds to S214 
of IsPETase.

CaPETase discusses_metric engineering. Evidence: Other sites
Besides the direct substrate-binding sites, the mutation of 
the surface charge was tried for CaPETase having Trp (char-
acteristic of type II enzymes) at the position of His164 in 
LCC (characteristic of type I enzymes).

CaPETase active_temperature 83.2 °C. Evidence: CaPETase M9 has a T m value of 83.2 °C 
and displayed more than 90% depolymerization of post-
consumer PET powder (3.75 g/150 mL) at 55 °C in 12 h 
in a pH-stat bioreactor.

CaPETase active_temperature 55 °C. Evidence: CaPETase M9 has a T m value of 83.2 °C 
and displayed more than 90% depolymerization of post-
consumer PET powder (3.75 g/150 mL) at 55 °C in 12 h 
in a pH-stat bioreactor.

BhrPETase active_temperature 84 °C. Evidence: (2024) used a computational strategy 
to redesign BhrPETase into TurboPETase, which reduced 
its Tm value from 101 °to 84 °C and acquired the highest 
activity outperforming  LCCICCG .

PETase discusses_metric activity. Evidence: Recently, a bacterial PET-degradingenzyme, PETase, was found to have the
ability to degrade the hcPET, but with low enzymatic activity.

PETase discusses_metric engineering. Evidence: Here we present
an engineered whole-cell biocatalyst to simulate both the adsorption and
degradation steps in the enzymatic degradation process of PETase to achieve
the efﬁcient degradation of hcPET.

PETase active_temperature 30 °C. Evidence: The turnover rateof the whole-cell biocatalyst toward
hcPET (crystallinity of 45%) dramatically increases approximately 328.8-fold
compared with that of puriﬁed PETase at 30 °C.

linker-GCW51 (removing PETase)/HFBI codisplay system and HFBI
single-display system, which are shown in Supplementary Fig.

PETase active_temperature 40 °C. Evidence: The optimal reaction temperature
was 40 °C, similar to native PETase, indicating that the codisplay cells
remained in a heat-labile degradation system

metadata.paper: ChemBioChem - 2024 - Joho - Enhancing PET Degrading Enzymes  A Combinatory Approach.pdf

text:
FAST-PETase targets_substrate PET. Evidence: For instance,
FAST-PETase is a variant of PsPETase that was developed
combining two mutations from the rational-engineered Ther-
moPETase and three other mutations identified with
MutCompute.

(PETase
A
) exhibited an increase in melting temperature of
~10 ° C while at the same time retaining a high level of activity
up even at 50 ° C.

metadata.paper: ChemBioChem - 2024 - Joho - Enhancing PET Degrading Enzymes  A Combinatory Approach.pdf

text:
PsPETase has_mutation D186A. Evidence: D186 is not conserved in other cutinase enzymes and is
most commonly a histidine in thermostable homologs, so the
single mutant of PsPETase D186A had not been explored
before.

metadata.paper: ChemBioChem - 2024 - Joho - Enhancing PET Degrading Enzymes  A Combinatory Approach.pdf

text:
ThermoPETase has_mutation D186H. Evidence: The substitution D186H alone does not provide better
activity but it led to the development of ThermoPETase
[11]
which
served as scaffold for developing other variants like
Figure 1.

text:
IsPETase discusses_metric activity. Evidence: [4]
Using IsPETase as a model system, numerous engineering
studies have been reported that present modified enzymes

metadata.paper: Engineering in Life Sciences - 2021 - Brott - Engineering and evaluation of thermostable IsPETase variants for PET.pdf

text:
PETase targets_substrate PET. Evidence: KEYWORDS
dataset, PET biodegradation, PET-hydrolytic enzymes (PETase), polyethylene terephthalate,
recycling
1 | INTRODUCTION
Plastics have become ubiquitous in human life due to
their durability, flexibility, and inexpensive production.

PETase discusses_metric activity. Evidence: To achieve this, we created the PETase Activity
Natural Dataset (PANDA), which contains the functional
information of 99 different naturally occurring PETases
(up to October 2024) and one engineered enzyme
(LCC_ICCG), a benchmark in the field (Erickson
et al.,
2022; Makryniotis et al., 2023; Tournier
et al.,2020) (Supplementary Table1).

PETase discusses_metric engineering. Evidence: To achieve this, we created the PETase Activity
Natural Dataset (PANDA), which contains the functional
information of 99 different naturally occurring PETases
(up to October 2024) and one engineered enzyme
(LCC_ICCG), a benchmark in the field (Erickson
et al.,
2022; Makryniotis et al., 2023; Tournier
et al.,2020) (Supplementary Table1).

PETase targets_substrate TPA. Evidence: In this review, any
enzyme degrading PET analogs with two or more TPA
moieties is referred to as a PETase, regardless of
whether PET is the enzyme’s natural or preferred sub-
strate, or the efficiency of degradation.

MHETase targets_substrate PET. Evidence: (a) Low-resolution SSN (alignment score threshold= 1, ≈20%
sequence identity) of 94 PETase sequences and three enzymes acting on PET degradation products: MHETase fromIdeonella sakaiensis
(Yoshida et al.,2016), and two BHETases fromBacillus subtilisand Chryseobacterium sp.

MHETase targets_substrate BHET. Evidence: (a) Low-resolution SSN (alignment score threshold= 1, ≈20%
sequence identity) of 94 PETase sequences and three enzymes acting on PET degradation products: MHETase fromIdeonella sakaiensis
(Yoshida et al.,2016), and two BHETases fromBacillus subtilisand Chryseobacterium sp.

MHETase targets_substrate MHET. Evidence: (a) Low-resolution SSN (alignment score threshold= 1, ≈20%
sequence identity) of 94 PETase sequences and three enzymes acting on PET degradation products: MHETase fromIdeonella sakaiensis
(Yoshida et al.,2016), and two BHETases fromBacillus subtilisand Chryseobacterium sp.

PETase targets_substrate BHET. Evidence: (a) Low-resolution SSN (alignment score threshold= 1, ≈20%
sequence identity) of 94 PETase sequences and three enzymes acting on PET degradation products: MHETase fromIdeonella sakaiensis
(Yoshida et al.,2016), and two BHETases fromBacillus subtilisand Chryseobacterium sp.

PETase targets_substrate MHET. Evidence: (a) Low-resolution SSN (alignment score threshold= 1, ≈20%
sequence identity) of 94 PETase sequences and three enzymes acting on PET degradation products: MHETase fromIdeonella sakaiensis
(Yoshida et al.,2016), and two BHETases fromBacillus subtilisand Chryseobacterium sp.

IsPETase targets_substrate PET. Evidence: first PETase to be discovered (Müller et al.,2005), and
clade ii contains IsPETase from Ideonella sakaiensis
(Yoshida et al.,2016), which received wide attention as
the first enzyme whose PET degradation capabilities
were shown to serve a physiological role.

IsPETase discusses_metric engineering. Evidence: (2022) successfully introduced mutations
inspired by IsPETase into the wild-type PETase PET6.

DuraPETase targets_substrate PET. Evidence: (2022) success-
fully introduced mutations inspired by DuraPETase, a
variant of IsPETase, to the enzymes LCC-ICCG and
PES-H1 (referred to as PHL7 in PANDA), respectively.

DuraPETase discusses_metric engineering. Evidence: (2022) success-
fully introduced mutations inspired by DuraPETase, a
variant of IsPETase, to the enzymes LCC-ICCG and
PES-H1 (referred to as PHL7 in PANDA), respectively.

BhrPETase targets_substrate PET. Evidence: The letter colors indicate the WT enzyme that was mutated: Purple (CaPETase), yellow (TfCut2), green (BhrPETase),
blue (LCC), and red (IsPETase).

CaPETase targets_substrate PET. Evidence: The letter colors indicate the WT enzyme that was mutated: Purple (CaPETase), yellow (TfCut2), green (BhrPETase),
blue (LCC), and red (IsPETase).

IsPETase discusses_metric activity. Evidence: IsPETase has
been extensively engineered, yielding improved vari-
ants with enhanced activity in thermophilic conditions
(Bell et al.,
2022; Cui et al.,2021; Joho et al.,2023,
2024; Lee et al.,2023; Lu et al.,2022; Shi et al.,2023;
Son et al.,2019).

IsPETase has_mutation N233K. Evidence: In 2020, the
enzyme FAST-PETase was developed, containing five
mutations compared to IsPETase (N233K, R224Q,
S121E, D186H, R280A), identified using a structure-
based machine learning algorithm (Lu et al.,
2022).

IsPETase has_mutation R224Q. Evidence: In 2020, the
enzyme FAST-PETase was developed, containing five
mutations compared to IsPETase (N233K, R224Q,
S121E, D186H, R280A), identified using a structure-
based machine learning algorithm (Lu et al.,
2022).

IsPETase has_mutation S121E. Evidence: In 2020, the
enzyme FAST-PETase was developed, containing five
mutations compared to IsPETase (N233K, R224Q,
S121E, D186H, R280A), identified using a structure-
based machine learning algorithm (Lu et al.,
2022).

mutations compared to IsPETase (N233K, R224Q,
S121E, D186H, R280A), identified using a structure-
based machine learning algorithm (Lu et al.,
2022).

mutations compared to IsPETase (N233K, R224Q,
S121E, D186H, R280A), identified using a structure-

mutations compared to IsPETase (N233K, R224Q,
S121E, D186H, R280A), identified using a structure-

Z1-PETase active_temperature 14 °C. Evidence: Z1-PETase degraded
/C24 75% of amorphous PET powder in 96 h at 30
/C14 C (Lee
et al.,2023) and produced/C24 4 times more degradation
products than the WT after 12 hours of incubation at
30/C14 C with amorphous PET powder (Lee et al.,2023).

IsPETase targets_substrate MHET. Evidence: For
example, IsPETase was fused to MHETase using
flexible glycine-serine linkers (Knott et al.,
2020;
Zhang et al., 2023) or other methods (Chen
et al., 2022), resulting in improved hydrolysis.

PETase discusses_metric stability. Evidence: The role of PETase half-life: Enzyme kinetic stabil-
ity, measured by half-life, is critical in designing
enzymes for industrial applications as it lowers the
enzyme amount required for the degradation pro-
cess, making it more economically viable.

HotPETase active_temperature 14 °C. Evidence: (2022), which compared
the performance of HotPETase (Tm of 82.5/C14 C) and
LCC-ICCG (Tm of 90.9/C14 C) at 65/C14 C.

HotPETase targets_substrate PET. Evidence: (2022), which compared
the performance of HotPETase (Tm of 82.5/C14 C) and

HotPETase discusses_metric stability. Evidence: (2022), which compared

Azoreductase discusses_metric stability. Evidence: Improving kinetic or
thermodynamic stability of an Azoreductase by directed evolu-
tion.

Suberinase targets_substrate PET. Evidence: Enzymatic degradation of p-Nitrophenyl
esters, polyethylene terephthalate, Cutin, and Suberin by Sub1,
a Suberinase encoded by the plant pathogen Streptomyces sca-
bies.

Cutinase targets_substrate PET. Evidence: Enhanced Cutinase-catalyzed hydrolysis of
polyethylene terephthalate by covalent fusion to Hydrophobins.

Cutinase discusses_metric activity. Evidence: Isolation of a novel Cutinase homolog with polyethylene
terephthalate-degrading activity from leaf-branch compost by
using a metagenomic approach.

IsPETase targets_substrate PET. Evidence: The benchmark IsPETase is
classified as a type IIb PETase and consists of a stabi-
lizing disulfide bond close to its active site.

PETase discusses_metric activity. Evidence: To compare the PETase-activity ofHaloPETase1 to
the benchmark PETase LCC-iccg (an activity and ther-
mostability improved variant) (Tournier et al.,2020), we
performed a hydrolysis time course measurement in a
PET-coated well plate.

PETase discusses_metric engineering. Evidence: To compare the PETase-activity ofHaloPETase1 to
the benchmark PETase LCC-iccg (an activity and ther-
mostability improved variant) (Tournier et al.,2020), we
performed a hydrolysis time course measurement in a
PET-coated well plate.

IsPETase discusses_metric engineering. Evidence: Similarly,IsPETase showed,
depending on the study, up to twoπ-π interactions by
Y87 and W185 (docking of tetrameric PET module and
mutational analysis) (Joo et al., 2018) or W185
(QM/MM analysis or complex crystal structure with
HEMT) (Burgin et al., 2024; Chen et al., 2021).

Assessment of the PETase conformational changes induced by
poly(ethylene terephthalate) binding
Clauber Henrique Souza da Costa1 | Alberto M.

text:
IsPETase targets_substrate PET. Evidence: sakaiensis strain 201-F6 (IsPETase) catalyzes the hydrolysis of PET converting it to
mono(2-hydroxyethyl) terephthalic acid (MHET), bis(2-hydroxyethyl)-TPA (BHET),
and terephthalic acid (TPA).

text:
IsPETase discusses_metric stability. Evidence: Despite the potential of this enzyme for mitigation or
elimination of environmental contaminants, one of the limitations of the use of
IsPETase for PET degradation is the fact that it acts only at moderate temperature
due to its low thermal stability.

text:
PETase targets_substrate BHET. Evidence: sakaiensisexpress two closely
related enzymes involved with PET degradation.6,11 The first enzyme
is named PETase (PET hydrolase), which converts PET to mono
(2-hydroxyethyl) terephthalic acid (MHET), bis(2-hydroxyethyl)-TPA
(BHET), and terephthalic acid (TPA) as products.

related enzymes involved with PET degradation.6,11 The first enzyme
is named PETase (PET hydrolase), which converts PET to mono
(2-hydroxyethyl) terephthalic acid (MHET), bis(2-hydroxyethyl)-TPA
(BHET), and terephthalic acid (TPA) as products.

ing enzyme for PET degradation, multiple studies have
shown that thermophilic PET hydrolases (e.g., LCC),
when operating at temperatures above 65°C, outper-
form mesophilic enzymes in PET biorecycling [30].

IsPETase discusses_metric stability. Evidence: Despite all efforts
devoted to the evolution of IsPETase, it appears that this
enzyme still suffers from an intrinsic lack of (thermo)stability,
and the catalytic properties of HotPETase, including product
inhibition, are still not aligned with the requirements for its
implementation in an enzyme-based PET depolymerization
process on the industrial scale.

ICCG

activity than chitinase or chitinase-like PET-degrading enzymes.

PETase targets_substrate MHET. Evidence: Considering the
synergistic effect on PET depolymerization, chimeric enzymes
were constructed withﬂexible glycine-serine linkers (8–20 glycine
and serine residues) connecting the C-terminus of MHETase to the
N-terminus of PETase.

MHETase discusses_metric activity. Evidence: This indicates that BHET could also be
hydrolysed by MHETase, which was further con ﬁrmed to
function in a concentration-dependent manner although with
as i g n iﬁcantly lower hydrolysing activity.

PETase targets_substrate TPA. Evidence: The special conformation of the, EG moiety
indicates that MHETase might also display exo-PETase activity
capable of hydrolysing the terminus of PET, which was conﬁrmed
by the successful hydrolysis of PET
5 to TPA.

MHETase has_mutation F424N. Evidence: Second, to remove the steric hindrance effect caused by
F424 located in the inner substrate-binding site and to provide
effective space and potential hydrogen bonding partners for BHET
binding, MHETase
F424N, MHETaseF424V, and MHETaseF424I were
constructed, and the BHET-hydrolysing activities were increased
by ~3.9-, 3.0-, and 3.4-fold, respectively.

R411K/F424N,
MHETaseR411K/F424V, and MHETase R411K/F424I) all displayed
improved catalytic activity, especially the MHETaseR411K/S416A/F424I
variant, which exhibited a 15.3-fold increase in BHET hydrolysis
activity.

PETase active_pH pH 8.5. Evidence: First, YebF-
mediated PETase secretion (N-terminal YebF fusion) enables near-
parallel expression in microplates, and then, ferric iron oxidation
(50 mM FeSO
4 +500 mM EDTA, pH 8.5) of PET-degrading
products results in ﬂuorophores (BHET-OH, MHET-OH, and
TPA-OH) that enable rapid activity quantiﬁcation.

stable and tolerant PETase) contains five mutations compared to wild-type PETase

superior PET-hydrolytic activity relative to both wild-type and engineered 
alternatives12 between 30 and 50 °C and a range of pH levels.

PETase has_mutation T140D. Evidence: 159 variants were generated by incorporating 
single or several predicted mutations into various PETase scaffolds to result in four 
mutations (S121E, T140D, R224Q and N233K) with the highest improvements both 
singly and in combination.

DuraPETase targets_substrate PET. Evidence: These mutations were combinatorially assembled 
across three PETase scaffolds: WT PETase (WT), ThermoPETase (Thermo) and 
DuraPETase (Dura).

DuraPETase discusses_metric engineering. Evidence: These mutations were combinatorially assembled 
across three PETase scaffolds: WT PETase (WT), ThermoPETase (Thermo) and 
DuraPETase (Dura).

PETase active_temperature 60 °C. Evidence: c, The red heatmap (left) shows the PET-hydrolytic activity of 
the resulting variants and the blue heatmap (right) shows the fold change of activity 
over their respective scaffolds on the basis of total PET monomers (the sum of TPA 
and MHET) released from hydrolysing circular gf-PET film (6 mm in diameter, 
roughly 11.4 mg) by the PETase variants after 96 h of incubation at temperature 
ranging

PETase targets_substrate TPA. Evidence: c, The red heatmap (left) shows the PET-hydrolytic activity of 
the resulting variants and the blue heatmap (right) shows the fold change of activity 
over their respective scaffolds on the basis of total PET monomers (the sum of TPA 
and MHET) released from hydrolysing circular gf-PET film (6 mm in diameter, 
roughly 11.4 mg) by the PETase variants after 96 h of incubation at temperature 
ranging

PETase targets_substrate MHET. Evidence: c, The red heatmap (left) shows the PET-hydrolytic activity of 
the resulting variants and the blue heatmap (right) shows the fold change of activity 
over their respective scaffolds on the basis of total PET monomers (the sum of TPA 
and MHET) released from hydrolysing circular gf-PET film (6 mm in diameter, 
roughly 11.4 mg) by the PETase variants after 96 h of incubation at temperature 
ranging

DuraPETase has_mutation N233K. Evidence: The highest change in thermostability from their respective PETase 
scaffolds were observed for variants PETaseT140D/N233K with a Tm of 58.1 ºC 
(ΔTm = 10 ºC from WT PETase), ThermoPETaseN233K with a Tm of 67.2 ºC 
(ΔTm = 9 ºC from ThermoPETase) and DuraPETase N233K with a Tm of 
83.5 ºC (ΔTm = 5 ºC from DuraPETase).
